result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Purdy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J Purdy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J Purdy was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).
  • Michael J Purdy was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant shall receive credit.  Sentence shall run on each count consecutive and consecutive to any other imposed sentence.
3-22-16 (2AJC as to restitution)

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No intoxicants.  Defendant shall not ingest any drugs or alcohol.  No contact with victims unless approved by agent.  Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Psychological and Cognitive Intervention as deemed appropriate.   Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Submit DNA sample.

 Before release from the Winnebago County Jail, you shall provide a DNA sample.

Restitution to be determined by the District Attorney within 30 days or deemed waived, any objections to be filed within 10 days of notice of determination. 

 3-22-16 Restitution Information attached

Motion on postconviction relief hearing on August 15, 2018 at 10:00 am.
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to July 3, 2018.
To extend time to file a postconviction motion
The time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to May 4, 2018.
Motion to Extend Time for Filing a Postconviction Motion
The time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to March 6, 2018.
to Extend Time for Filing A Postconviction Motion

It is Ordered that the April 25, 2017 order holding the appeal in abeyance is vacated. 
It is Further Ordered that the no-merit report is rejected and the no-merit appeal is dismissed without prejudice.
It is Further Ordered that the time under WIS.STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(h) for filing a postconviction motion is extended to sixty days from the date of this order. See WIS.STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a).
It is Further Ordered that this summary disposition order will not be published.
